prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be a research student. She's camped out to photograph shooting stars.
Character 4
Name: Larry Butz
Description: A friend and former classmate. Also my first client. Often the cause of trouble.
Character 5
Name: Marvin Grossberg
Description: A veteran defense attorney, and Mia's mentor.
Character 6
Name: Robert Hammond
Description: The victim in this case. Also, the defense attorney in the DL-6 Incident.
Character 7
Name: Misty Fey
Description: Mia and Maya's mother, and a spirit medium. Disappeared after the DL-6 Incident.
Character 8
Name: Gregory Edgeworth
Description: Victim in the DL-6 Incident, 15 years ago. A defense attorney and Miles's father.
Character 9
Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: Veteran prosecutor who hasn't lost a case in his 40-year career. Edgeworth's mentor.
Character 10
Name: Old Caretaker → Yanni Yogi
Description: Caretaker of the boat rental shop in Gourd Lake Park. Thinks he runs a restaurant.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Popper
Description: A classic party noisemaker. Pull the string, it goes "bang". Not very clue-worthy.
Evidence 2
Name: Lotta's Camera
Description: Set to automatically take a picture when a loud noise is detected. Faces the lake.
Evidence 3
Name: Autopsy Report → Robert's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Cause: one bullet shot to the heart. Time of death: sometime on the 24th or 25th. Shot from approximately one meter away.
Evidence 4
Name: Lake Photo
Description: Taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. [caption] One person is holding a gun and firing at another person. The fog is so dense that neither of the men's faces can be seen clearly.
Evidence 5
Name: Gourdy Article
Description: Article about a monster sighted at Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Misty Fey's Photo
Description: An old photograph. "DL-6 Incident - Exhibit A" is written on the back.
Evidence 7
Name: Edgeworth's Request
Description: Document proving Edgeworth's request for an attorney.
Evidence 8
Name: Overhead Map
Description: Overhead map of Gourd Lake. Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol Bullet
Description: Found in the victim's body. Fired from a 22-caliber pistol. Found in the victim's body. The ballistic markings match the murder weapon's barrel.
Evidence 10
Name: Pistol
Description: The murder weapon. 22-caliber. Fired 3 times. Bears prints from Edgeworth's right hand.
Evidence 11
Name: Lotta's Deposition
Description: "I heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25."
Evidence 12
Name: Missile
Description: A K-9 unit in training. Very cute, with shiny eyes.
Evidence 13
Name: Fishing Pole
Description: Detective Gumshoe's personal fishing pole. Sadly flimsy and of dubious utility.
Evidence 14
Name: Metal Detector
Description: Makes a noise when metallic objects are near. A useful detection device.
Evidence 15
Name: Air Tank
Description: An empty air tank. The valve is open, and a banner of flags is wrapped around it.
Evidence 16
Name: Second Lake Photo
Description: Shows an empty lake. Taken automatically on 12/24 at 11:50 PM.
Evidence 17
Name: Parrot
Description: The erstwhile companion of the boat rental shop caretaker. Answers to the name "Polly".
Evidence 18
Name: DL-6 Case File
Description: File on the DL-6 Incident. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: DL-6 Incident Photo
Description: Photograph of the scene of the murder. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Letter from the Safe
Description: "Get your revenge on Miles Edgeworth." This note details the murder and set up.
Evidence 21
Name: DL-6 Bullet
Description: Taken from Gregory Edgeworth's heart. Still bears clear ballistic markings.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I saw it clear as day. The man on the boat was Mr. Edgeworth!
Person: Lotta

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's go through the information step by step.

First, I'll look at the characters involved. There's Lotta Hart, who claims to have seen Miles Edgeworth on the boat. Then there's the evidence, specifically Evidence 4, which is a photo taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. The caption says it shows one person holding a gun and firing at another, but the fog is so thick that neither face is visible clearly.

Lotta's testimony (Testimony 0) is that she saw Miles Edgeworth on the boat clearly. But the photo (Evidence 4) shows that the faces were not visible due to the fog. This seems like a direct contradiction because Lotta claims she saw him clearly, while the photo suggests that it was impossible to see anyone's face clearly at that time.

So, the contradiction is between Evidence 4 and Testimony 0. Lotta's claim that she saw Edgeworth clearly conflicts with the photo evidence showing that the fog obscured the faces.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by going through the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided.

First, the characters include Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Lotta Hart, Larry Butz, Marvin Grossberg, Robert Hammond, Misty Fey, Gregory Edgeworth, Manfred von Karma, and Yanni Yogi. The key ones here seem to be Lotta Hart, who is a research student camping out to photograph shooting stars, and Robert Hammond, the victim.

Looking at the evidences, there are several important ones. Evidence 2 is Lotta's Camera, which is set to automatically take pictures when a loud noise is detected and faces the lake. Evidence 4 is a Lake Photo taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM, showing a person holding a gun and firing at another, but the fog makes it hard to see their faces. Evidence 11 is Lotta's Deposition, where she says she heard two sounds like gunshots just after midnight on 12/25.

Now, the testimonies provided are from Lotta Hart. She mentions that she heard a noise, used her binoculars, and her camera was set up to capture a meteor shower. She also heard two gunshots.

So, the key point here is that Lotta's camera took a photo at 12:15 AM on 12/25, which shows a shooting incident. However, in her deposition, she states that she heard two gunshots. If the camera was set to take photos upon detecting loud noises, it should have taken two photos for two gunshots. But according to the evidence, there's only one photo captured at 12:15 AM. This suggests a contradiction because the number of photos doesn't match the number of sounds she reported hearing.

Therefore, the evidence that shows only one photo being taken contradicts her testimony of hearing two gunshots. This inconsistency indicates that either the camera didn't capture both shots, or she misheard the number of shots, or perhaps there was another explanation for the discrepancy.
</think>

cot:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by going through all the information provided.

First, the characters involved include Maya Fey, Miles Edgeworth, Dick Gumshoe, Lotta Hart, Larry Butz, Marvin Grossberg, Robert Hammond, Misty Fey, Gregory Edgeworth, Manfred von Karma, and Yanni Yogi. The evidence list has 22 items, and there are 8 testimonies from Lotta Hart.

Looking at the testimonies, Lotta Hart claims she's an investigative photographer camping out by Gourd Lake to capture a monster sighting. She set up her camera to take pictures when a loud noise occurred, and it was facing the lake. She heard two gunshots just after midnight on 12/25 and used her binoculars to see what happened. Her camera took a photo at 12:15 AM showing a man with a gun firing at another person, but the fog was too thick to see their faces.

Now, looking at the evidence, there's a Lake Photo (Evidence 4) taken automatically on 12/25 at 12:15 AM. It shows one person holding a gun and firing at another, but the fog is so dense that their faces aren't visible. There's also a Second Lake Photo (Evidence 16) taken on 12/24 at 11:50 PM, which shows an empty lake.

Wait, that's interesting. If Lotta's camera took a photo at 12:15 AM showing the shooting, but the Second Lake Photo at 11:50 PM shows an empty lake, that means there's a 25-minute gap between these two photos. If the lake was empty at 11:50 PM, how could the shooting happen at 12:15 AM? It suggests that the shooting either didn't happen or happened after the second photo was taken.

Also, Lotta's testimony mentions she heard two gunshots and saw a flash from the boat. But the Second Lake Photo shows an empty lake just before the supposed shooting. This creates a contradiction because if the lake was empty at 11:50 PM, it's unlikely that the shooting occurred right after, as the photos don't align with her account.

So, the key contradiction is between Evidence 4 (Lake Photo) and Testimony 7, where Lotta describes seeing the shooting. The Second Lake Photo (Evidence 16) taken earlier shows the lake empty, conflicting with her claim of seeing the shooting just after midnight.
</think>
